app-decrypt-confirm:
You are attempting to decrypt the dataset $1. 

Please only proceed if you are using a secure and trusted computer approved by your institution.

Do you want to continue?
app-decrypt-desc: To decrypt an encrypted data package downloaded from FRDR, you must copy and paste the Vault Key URL from the email you received approving your access request.
app-decrypt-input-missing: Please select the encrypted package you want to decrypt. This is the encrypted data package you downloaded from FRDR.
app-decrypt-input-tooltip: Select the encrypted package you want to decrypt
app-decrypt-output-missing: Please select a location for the decrypted dataset.
app-decrypt-output-tooltip: Please ensure the selected location is secure and appropriate for storing restricted use files.
app-decrypt-url-missing: Please add the Vault Key URL, which is available in the email you received approving your access request.
app-desc: Welcome to the FRDR Encryption Application. You can use the app to encrypt, decrypt, and share access to sensitive datasets with the Federated Research Data Repository.
app-desc-homepage:
Welcome to the FRDR Encryption Application. Please select one of the menu options above to get started.

If you need to deposit restricted-use data in FRDR, click “Encrypt Dataset” and follow the steps to create an encrypted data package for deposit. After your dataset is published, you can manage who has access to your access-restricted files using the “Grant Access” option above.

If you have applied for permission to access-restricted files in FRDR, and your application was approved, click “Decrypt Dataset” and follow the steps to extract the contents of the encrypted data package you downloaded from FRDR.
app-encrypt-confirm: After you encrypt your dataset you CANNOT add or change files. Please ensure the dataset is COMPLETE before you encrypt the dataset.
app-encrypt-done: Your encrypted data package has been created at $1
app-encrypt-done-text1: Your dataset has been encrypted. Please continue to FRDR to upload the encrypted data package in your deposit. It must be added to the “sensitive” directory on the “Transfer Data” tab of the submission interface.
app-encrypt-info: To deposit access-limited data on FRDR, you must create an encrypted package. Each deposit may contain only one encrypted package. Please put the file(s) or folders you intend to deposit in one top-level directory, and ensure the files are not compressed (i.e., no .zip or .gz files).
app-encrypt-input-missing: Please select the directory that contains the dataset you want to encrypt.
app-encrypt-input-tooltip: Select the top-level directory that contains the data file(s) you want to encrypt.
app-encrypt-output-missing: Please select the output location for your encrypted package.
app-encrypt-output-tooltip: Choose a location on your local machine or server to output the encrypted data package.
app-export-key-copied-clipboard:
Private key copied to clipboard!

The clipboard will be automatically cleared in 30 seconds for security.
app-export-key-copy-desc: Copy your private key content to clipboard for backup.
app-export-key-error-no-password: Please enter a password to protect your private key.
app-export-key-error-password-length: Password must be at least 12 characters long.
app-export-key-error-password-mismatch: Passwords do not match. Please try again.
app-export-key-error-password-weak:
Password is too weak. It must include:
• At least 12 characters
• Uppercase letters (A-Z)
• Lowercase letters (a-z)
• Numbers (0-9)
• Special characters (!@#$%^&*...)
app-export-key-file-desc: Save a copy of your private key to a secure location.
app-export-key-info: Access and backup your private key
app-export-key-location-desc: View where your private key is stored on your computer.
app-export-key-modal-desc: Create a strong password to protect your private key export.
app-export-key-open-folder-confirm: Do you want to open the folder containing the exported file?
app-export-key-password-hint: Use at least 12 characters with letters, numbers, and symbols.
app-export-key-reveal-confirm:
Are you sure you want to reveal your private key?

Make sure no one is looking at your screen and that you are in a secure location.
app-export-key-success-message:
Private Key Exported Successfully!

File saved to:
$1

IMPORTANT: Please remember your password as you will need it to extract and use this key. Store this file in a secure location and never share your password or the file with anyone.
app-export-key-warning-1: Never share your private key with anyone
app-export-key-warning-2: Store it in a secure location
app-export-key-warning-3: Anyone with access to your private key can decrypt your data
app-export-key-warning-text: Never share your private key with anyone. Store it securely. Anyone with access to your private key can decrypt your data.
app-get-entity-id-error:
Error getting user entity id on Vault. 
$1.
app-get-entity-id-from-frdr-error: Your Vault ID is not retrieved from FRDR successfully. Please go to Settings page and make sure it is set correctly on FRDR
app-get-entity-name-error:
Error getting user email on Vault. 
$1.
app-grant-access-confirm:
If you continue, you will grant $1 permission to download and decrypt $2. 

Please confirm the dataset title and the requester name included here are correct before you grant access. 

Do you want to continue?
app-grant-access-dataset-missing: Please add the Dataset ID to grant access to the dataset.
app-grant-access-desc: To approve an access request, add the Dataset ID and Requester ID from the email you received about this request, click Grant Access, and navigate back to FRDR to finish approving the request.
app-grant-access-done-text: You have successfully granted access to the decryption key for this dataset. Please return to FRDR to complete the approval process by digitally signing the data access agreement.
app-grant-access-expire-tooltip: Your approval is time-sensitive. The applicant must download and decrypt the data before $1.
app-grant-access-find-dataset-error:
Error finding the dataset in FRDR. Please ensure the Dataset ID you included on the Grant Access page is correct. You can find the Dataset ID in the access request email sent by FRDR. 
$1.
app-grant-access-find-user-error:
Error finding the user in Vault. Please ensure the Requester ID you included on the Grant Access page is correct. You can find the Requester ID in the access request email sent by FRDR. 
$1.
app-grant-access-requester-missing: Please add the Requester ID of the applicant to grant access to the dataset.
app-import-key-error-empty: Please paste your private key content.
app-import-key-error-invalid-format: Invalid private key format. Please make sure you paste the complete key including the BEGIN and END markers.
app-import-key-error-mismatch: The selected file and pasted text do not match. Please use only one input method.
app-import-key-error-no-input: Please select a file or paste your private key.
app-import-key-from-file-desc: Select your private key file (.pem or .key format)
app-import-key-from-text-desc: Paste your private key content directly below
app-import-key-info: Your private key was not found locally. Please import your private key to continue using app. Make sure you're importing the correct private key that matches your public key on the vault.
app-import-key-warning-text: Make sure you're importing the correct private key that matches your public key on the vault.
app-login-frdr-desc: Click the button below to log in to an existing FRDR account, or to create a new account in FRDR. FRDR uses Globus Auth to manage login.
app-login-frdr-success-message: Your authentication to FRDR was successful. Kindly return to the FRDR Encryption Application and click on "Log in with Globus" again. In this second step, you will be authenticating to access FRDR's instance of Vault, where your encryption keys will be managed. You may close this tab now.
app-login-url-tooltip: If running for development, probably http://127.0.0.1:8200.
app-login-vault-desc:
Please click "Login with Globus" again to log in to FRDR's instance of Vault, where your encryption keys will be managed.

If this is the first time you have signed in to FRDR's instance of Vault, you will be asked to allow frdrvault.net to view the Globus identity and email address associated with your FRDR account.
app-login-vault-error:
Error logging into Vault with Globus OAuth. 
$1
app-login-vault-local-keys-error-text: You are not able to use FRDR Encryption Application on this device
app-login-vault-local-keys-error-title: Error with local public and private key pair
app-login-vault-success-message: Your authentication to Vault was successful, you may close this tab now.
app-profile-copy-error-2: Copy to clipboard: Ctrl+C or Command+C, Enter
app-request-access-confirm-msg: Please copy the following id to the Requester ID Field on the Access Request Page on FRDR.
app-request-access-intro1:
Your Vault User ID is unique to your FRDR account. The ID is required to access restricted-use datasets in FRDR, and it will be pre-populated in each access request you submit.

This ID has been sent to FRDR automatically and is listed under "Sensitive Data" on your account
app-request-access-intro2: page. If you find that your Vault ID is not recorded in your FRDR Settings, please contact support@frdr-dfdr.ca for help.
app-send-entity-id-to-frdr-error: Your Vault User ID has not been sent to FRDR successfully. Please contact support@frdr-dfdr.ca for help.
app-verify-keys-error-detail: Would you like to import your private key now?
